contexts.context: To illustrate the Rothschild <mark>profitableness</mark> it is sufficient to provide one number: Baron...
..., but his ownership in oil springs is more <mark>profitable</mark>. The Londonese Rothschild specialised in mercury and copper...
...other side is unraveled. It is non-<mark>profitable</mark> to cut the papyrus apart, bend on top...
...not want to split off Austria. Both countries <mark>profit</mark> from the mutual cohabitation: First, the monarchy...
